fields.description:
On shared setup #2 I used built in template "Load Balanced AutoScaling Web Application " to create a stack. 

After the stack was created I could not modify the health check on the ELB created by this stack because it does not take the path parameter that I am trying to supply and fails with "You must supply a ping_path" error.
fields.summary: Can not modify health check on ELB created by Cloud Formation template

comments.body:
The template specifies:
          "Target" : "HTTP:8888/",

which is a perfectly valid ping path per: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-elb-health-check.html

Also see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/quickref-elb.html

If it wasn't valid the stack wouldn't create the resource. I think the problem lays elsewhere (see GUI-2127)

Fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1621

[~alice]: Could you create another ELB from a CF stack that has an apparently "empty" path? Note that the stack-created ELB should display '/' as the ping path rather than an empty string, and the health check update should work after PR 1621 is in.

In my opinion we should include this fix in 4.2, since modifying health checks is critical functionality. [~tony] are you OK with including this fix in 4.2 release?  [~dcalzago], can we possibly expedite the decision on this fix?

[~alice], this is not VPC specific then correct? Also,is it not possible to modify or add health check for ELB via the GUI because of this? If the latter is true I say we have to fix it. Otherwise, I would like to understand the issue a little more.

[~tony] This bug is not VPC specific, and I can see it only on ELBs created via Cloud Formation stack. I reproduced it on both Shared setup #1 and setup #2. So when there is an ELB created via CF stack, then it is impossible to change health check on it in any way, and the user gets "ping_path: Ping path is required!" error.
Thanks, [~alice]. [~kgill], does your proposed fix solve this? It looks like your fix is in elb but this seems like a cloud formation only.
Tony, read my comment about valid health check ping paths. We weren't allowing a valid value, so that's why we failed on the one created by the stack.
[~tony] Yes, I forgot to add that also, the health check initially created by the stack does not work because of this bug.
Thanks all. Let's get this in 4.2.0

This doesn't address the original concern in GUI-2127 as I still get a target with double slash.
:<ConfigureHealthCheckResponse xmlns="http://elasticloadbalancing.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-12-01/"><ConfigureHealthCheckResult><HealthCheck><Target>HTTP:80//</Target>...

Anyway, I've updated the regex to require 1 slash which is more correct. Our client side still requires "something" in the path, then when I enter "/", it puts 2 slashes in the HC target. 
Part of the problem is here: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/views/elbs.py#L294
it always inserts a slash, regardless of what's in the path.
I'd argue we should allow an empty path and if a user enters a leading slash, we trim that off, but keep the slash in the pattern on line 294.

I'm kind of on the fence about that leading slash in the form field. We default to "index.html", yet we require some input. "/" or "/index.html" should be options, but not just "index.html" if we want to present consistent information for users.

[~dkavanagh]: I just added a comment to https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1621 .  I think the regex suggested in my latest comment should address this ticket and GUI-2127.  Lemme know what you think, and if that regex looks good feel free to change it or punt this ticket back to me to update it?

After my initial regex escape comment, I realized it was a server-side validation check.

Per my other comments, what still bugs me is that we don't accurately reflect what's in the hc target path in the GUI.
2 examples:
 - we default to "index.html", which is actually written as "/index.html"
 - we don't allow empty string, which would wind up being "/", which is perfectly valid.

I think we should either display the full HC target path in the field (require it, and ensure it starts with a leading slash), or allow it to be empty and allow for a user to either enter a leading slash or now, but that become ambiguous.
[~dkavanagh]: I just pushed a fix that addresses your concerns while you were typing that comment :-)... https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/4cccdeefe7cb31bbe26a25279541f6fee4ece2c1
[~tony], [~kgill] There is some issue with the slave, I will relaunch it now.
I added to the validation error, even if the validation check isn't changed.

Verified.  I was able to modify the health check settings and change the path.
